definition[0]: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine
example[0]: The paper’s leading article (=the main article) described the government as weak.
definition[1]: a thing, especially one of a group of things
example[4]: She only took a few articles of clothing with her.
definition[2]: a part of a law or legal agreement that deals with a particular point
example[5]: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
definition[3]: a word used before a noun to show whether the noun refers to a particular example of something or to a general example of something. In English, ‘the’ is called the definite article and ‘a’ and ‘an’ are called the indefinite article.
example[6]: He writes newspaper articles in the Guardian.
example[7]: The couple talked frankly about their joy at having a new baby in a magazine article published yesterday.
example[8]: I wrote a few feature articles on sporting events.
example[9]: There was an interesting article on Russia in the paper today.
example[10]: Look at this leading article from Newsweek’s business section.
example[11]: The protest followed a front-page article in the Herald three weeks ago.
example[12]: Each issue contains in-depth articles and photographs.
example[13]: The Times have asked me if I will do an article on the election.
example[14]: It was good to see such an intelligent article on censorship.
example[15]: The magazine carried an article on the dangers of being overweight.
collocation[10]: an article appears in a newspaper/magazine
example[16]: A couple of articles appeared in local papers, but nothing else.
definition[4]: a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine about a particular subject
example[17]: Greg began his career writing articles for the college magazine.
definition[5]: an article in a newspaper about a recent event, especially one that a lot of people find interesting or exciting
example[20]: I read a newspaper story about the crash.
example[21]: The local paper ran a story  (=published a story) about the festival.
definition[6]: a short article in a newspaper or magazine
example[22]: I’ve written a couple of pieces for the New York Times magazine.
example[23]: The piece was first published in the Observer.
definition[7]: a special article about a particular subject, often with photographs and continuing for several pages
example[24]: They had a special feature on Croatia.
example[25]: The paper did a big feature on growing your own food.
definition[8]: an article in a newspaper or magazine about a book, play, product, hotel etc, giving someone’s opinion of it
example[26]: The play had rave reviews  (=people liked it a lot - an informal use).
example[27]: Did you see the review of the new Coldplay album?
definition[9]: an article by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine
example[28]: He has a weekly column in the Times.
example[29]: She writes a newspaper column on gardening.
definition[10]: a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the personal opinion of the editor about something that is in the news
example[30]: Several years ago the New York Times published an editorial stating that the appropriate minimum wage is $0.00.
definition[11]: an article that has been cut from a newspaper or magazine
example[31]: His mother has kept all his old press cuttings.
definition[12]: one part of a law or legal agreement, especially a numbered part
definition[13]: in Britain, a period of training with a firm of SOLICITORs which someone who wants to be a lawyer must complete before they can become fully qualified
example[33]: After graduation, she returned to her father’s solicitor’s practice to take her articles.
